definitions.definition: a very young child or animal
definitions.labels: (especially US English)(especially North American English)(especially British English)(British English)(North American English)(especially British English)

examples.text: The baby's crying!
a newborn baby
My sister's **expecting a baby** *(= she is pregnant)*.
She **had a baby** last year.
The **baby was born** last night.
**Mother and baby** are doing well.
The baby is due in October.
The baby was delivered by a midwife.
a baby boy/girl
a baby daughter/son/sister/brother
baby food/clothes
a baby monkey/blackbird
They are not sure if they want a baby.
Can you take the baby while I unlock the door?
He took an interest in the growing baby even before it was born.
I could feel the baby moving inside me.
She lost her baby three months into her pregnancy.
The doctor said the baby was growing nicely.
They named the baby Charlie.
Their first baby arrived three weeks early.
She decided to put her baby up for adoption.
They would like to adopt a newborn baby.
Young children and unborn babies are at greatest risk.
Premature babies are at increased risk of health problems.
She rocked the baby to sleep in her arms.
The baby cooed happily on the rug.
He just broke down and cried like a baby.
She's a midwife in an intensive care unit for premature babies.
The illness is common in newborn babies and is easily treated.
Smoking in pregnancy increases the risk of producing a low birthweight baby.
After some months, the baby learns to walk along branches by holding onto its mother's fur.
What do you call a baby kangaroo?

definitions.definition: the youngest member of a family or group

examples.text: He's the baby of the team.

definitions.definition: a person who behaves like a young child and is easily upset

examples.text: Stop crying and don't be such a baby.

definitions.definition: a word used to address somebody, especially your wife, husband or partner, in a way that expresses love but that can be offensive if used by a man to a woman he does not know
to be a plan or project that somebody is responsible for and cares about because they have created it
used to emphasize how easy it is to do something

examples.text: I thought it was going to be difficult to get funding for the project, but in the end it was like taking candy from a baby.

definitions.definition: to suddenly make somebody responsible for something important that is really your responsibility

examples.text: He changed to another job and we were left holding the baby.
He was so tired after all his exertions, he slept like a baby.
I usually sleep like a log.

definitions.definition: to lose something that you want at the same time as you are trying to get rid of something that you do not want

wordOrigin: late Middle English: probably imitative of an infant's first attempts at speech.
